Articles.Content:
[@blacsky33](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/129435-blacsky33/)so I've read through the entire thread and there is a lot of gold here, but is it all listed and up to date in the first post, or do I have to dig for it? I'm still on 1.0.5 so I don;t mind using an older version, actually.

Cheers, your work looks grand.
All mods are available in first post for ksp 1.0.5, I'm just showing new parts i ll release with 1.1 .
Gotcha; thanks!
Can you please use .zip files? My computer can't read .rar files, but these parts look really cool.

Hi [@blacsky33](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/129435-blacsky33/) looks like landing leg models will need to be updated for 1.1, there are very few compatible currently on the forums. Would be nice to have your parts working.

Here's some relevant info:

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/135250-landing-legs-in-11/&do=embed"></iframe>
My landing legs are still working in pre 1.1 , i just need update from NFT for double side solar panel.

[@blacsky33](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/129435-blacsky33/)

I do not understand why you need the NFT plugin. 

On the picture you can see:

1. Part with 4 directions of solarpanels in Unity (z-axis beam to the potential lightsource)  

2. Settings in .cfg file.  

3. Ingame (KSP 1.1) menu you can see the flow of energy of 2 of 4 solarpanels

The only negative is that the part is always under "Status: direct sunlight"

![oxWJemO.png](http://i.imgur.com/oxWJemO.png)

I found an other problem , i can't complete transmitting data.  Someone know how t fix it?

![nwbszyl.png](http://i.imgur.com/nwbszyl.png)

![Hofvomj.png](http://i.imgur.com/Hofvomj.png)

launch escape system, (with rcs control at the top).

![CxVnK03.png](http://i.imgur.com/CxVnK03.png)

MEM for mk1 (1 decoupler 1.25to0.675 // 1 enginefueltank // 1 descentefueltanklegsrcs ).

![kLZLV46.png](http://i.imgur.com/kLZLV46.png)

![wa9D4iX.png](http://i.imgur.com/wa9D4iX.png)

![YyZW2Nc.png](http://i.imgur.com/YyZW2Nc.png)

WIP rework luna rover plateform and luna descente module...

I recognize that pod... ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

**1.1 UPDATE**

Before install in GameData folder, uninstalled previous version of MBI ( it can break crafts files).

For solar panels you need install latest version of Near Futur Solar (v.0.6.0) , thx to Nertea.

update v1.1.1 octo lander  = [https://www.dropbox.com/s/w9jz4mw8gfp8eu4/MBIv1.1.1octo.rar?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/w9jz4mw8gfp8eu4/MBIv1.1.1octo.rar?dl=0)

update v1.1.1  parts = [https://www.dropbox.com/s/1c0l6ix007ll4hm/MBIv1.1.1parts.rar?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/1c0l6ix007ll4hm/MBIv1.1.1parts.rar?dl=0)

update v1.1.1 retro  = [https://www.dropbox.com/s/pes4rzxxycarsy8/MBIv1.1.1retro.rar?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/pes4rzxxycarsy8/MBIv1.1.1retro.rar?dl=0)

Give me feedback if there is issue...
Holy smokes dude how does this not get more attention? It's awesome!
it looks really cool. super compact vessels.

When I EVA a kerb from the Ring Command Pod Mk.1, it makes the ship spin/tumble violently, additionally, there seems to be no way to get back in. There's a crew hatch, but there's no "Press F to grab/B to board" prompt.

I very much like the pack, just some issues I ran into.

> 
> 
> On 4/26/2016 at 8:44 PM, Nnimrod said:
> 
> 
> When I EVA a kerb from the Ring Command Pod Mk.1, it makes the ship spin/tumble violently, additionally, there seems to be no way to get back in. There's a crew hatch, but there's no "Press F to grab/B to board" prompt.
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I very much like the pack, just some issues I ran into.
> 

I ran into this EXACT same issue.  On my first manned orbital mission.  With a contract to EVA.

Needless to say, now I need a rescue mission ![-_-](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_sleep.png "-_-")

> 
> 
> On 5.4.2016 at 4:53 PM, Andem said:
> 
> 
> Can you please use .zip files? My computer can't read .rar files, but these parts look really cool.
> 

Mac or Linux? If not: Install 7zip ([http://www.7-zip.org/](http://www.7-zip.org/)); it's a must have anyway.

But I would prefer zips, too.

>
